summary: Hillary Clinton defends herself against Bernie Sanders' claim that she is not tough on Wall Street by stating that her record is public and speaks for itself.

Hillary Clinton claimed during a press meeting on April 4th, 2016 that the assertions and conclusions made about her email controversy were incorrect. She also stated that she received the majority of newspaper endorsements, all of which had analyzed the information and conducted interviews. Clinton admitted that sending emails on government accounts would have been the better choice, but she believed it was a matter of convenience and acknowledged that it was a mistake.
